title_sort: abraham simpson to walt whitman, 10 may 1867
title: Abraham Simpson to Walt Whitman, 10 May 1867
text: New York Medical Journal,18 BEEKMAN STREET,NEW YORK,May 10 1867.Mr. Walt WhitmanDear SirI am about to go into business in a few days, and hearing you are writing another book would like to print and publish it for you and will give you better books and wages than any other publishing house. If you think favorably of it will you write me what time you think it will be ready when I will commence to advertise it in some journals I now controlâ€”gratis. It being my fresh efforts at publishing, I know to make exhaustive efforts to have an extensive sale.One of my reasons for securing your friendship is my appreciation for you as a man and knowing your life has been devoted to help along those most in need of your assistance. I being about to make a start know you will if possible give me a helping hand. I shall take the liberty of enclosing as soon as my arrangement for location is completed.Hoping you will confer a favor on me by replying I beg to remain,Yours very truly,Abraham Simpson Abraham Simpson to Walt Whitman, 10 May 1867
